column1: north~The direction that is to your left when you are facing the rising sun~[nɔːθ] The compass points north. The wind is coming from the north.
parking~The act of stopping and leaving a vehicle in a particular place~[ˈpɑːkɪŋ] There is no parking allowed on this street. We found a parking spot near the entrance.
passenger~A person who is traveling in a vehicle but is not driving it~[ˈpæsɪndʒər] The bus was full of passengers. Each passenger must have a valid ticket.
south~The direction that is to your right when you are facing the rising sun~[saʊθ] They drove south for the winter. The birds migrate south every year.
stay~To remain in a particular place~[steɪ] We decided to stay at a hotel. Please stay here while I go get help.

column2: typically inflated or surrounding an inflated inner tube
column3: placed around a wheel to form a flexible contact with the road~[taɪər] I need to replace the front tire of my bike. The car has a flat tire.

column1: toward~In the direction of~[təˈwɔːd] She walked toward the door. The cat moved toward the window.
traffic~The movement of vehicles along a road~[ˈtræfɪk] There is heavy traffic on the highway. Traffic lights control the flow of traffic.
vacation~A period of time when you are not at work or school~[vəˈkeɪʃən] We are planning a vacation to the beach. She took a two-week vacation in Europe.
visitor~Someone who visits a person or place~[ˈvɪzɪtər] We had a visitor from out of town. The museum had many visitors last year.
